This document is meant for YaST2 development only.
Configuration of printer subsystem. Version &version; - &date;
Overview
YaST2 Printer configurator (printconf) should help user to set up local and network printers.
Requires: CUPS
Does not work with LPRng
History: Until 8.0 printer configuration supported only LPRng based spoolers. CUPS was supported via separate configuration module. Versions 8.1 to 9.0 supported both LPRng and CUPS. Since 9.1 only CUPS is supported.
Printer vs. Queue
For understanding the printer configuration problems you should keep in mind that there is a difference between physical device - Printer and logical device - Queue. There can be any number of queues assigned to one printer.
There can be special kind of queue - raw queue. This queue doesn't perform filtering and sends the data to the printer unchanged.
Queue types
In general there are 3 types of print queues. Queue with filtering, raw queue and CUPS class.
Queue with Filtering
has assigned a PPD file which defines which filter it uses and which options can be set.
Raw Queue
doesn't perform filtering at all.
CUPS Class
just forwards the job to one of the queues that are members of the class.
We can divide queues by connection. See for connection reference. But from the viewpoint of printer configuration there are no internal differences between various types of queues.
The workflow
Actually there are 2 types of workflow.
auto-configuration
for preparing the profile for autoinstallation. Starts in the complex dialog (with Add/Edit/Delete buttons)
auto-detected printers
for manual configuration of autodetected printers -- this is started by default from control center.
